Abduction.definition: the action of abducting [ of a robbery victim] b

1 a.definition: the action of abducting [ of a robbery victim]

sub_terms.b: the tort or felony of abducting a person

2.definition: the unlawful carrying away of a wife or female child or ward for the purpose of marriage or sexual intercourse
2.note: Sense 2 has its roots in common law. As statutorily defined, mainly in the nineteenth century, abduction is generally stated to include taking away or detention of a woman under a certain age, usually 16 or 18, with or without her consent or knowledge of her age.
